intro: Mouriri doriana, commonly known as the Doriana mouriri, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon Basin. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy surface. The flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female parts present on the same plant, making it monoecious.
